name: Geranium maculatum
Relationship: Compare: GERMANIN. 1x. Constant hawking and spitting in elderly people. ERODIUM - Hemlock - Stork's bill - (a popular hemostatic in Russia, and especially used for metrorrhagia and menorrhagia); HYDRASTININE; CINCH.; SABIN.

Head: Giddiness, with diplopia; better, closing eyes
Ptosis and dilated pupils
Sick headache
Stomach: Catarrhal gastritis with profuse secretion, tendency to ulceration and passive hemorrhage
LESSENS THE VOMITING IN GASTRIC ULCER
Stool: Constant desire to go to stool, with inability to pass anything for some time
Mouth: Dry; tip of tongue burning Pharyngitis

details: Habitual sick headaches. PROFUSE, HEMORRHAGES, pulmonary and from different organs. Vomiting of blood. ULCERATION OF STOMACH. ATONIC AND FOUL ULCERS. Summer complaint.
dosage: Tincture, half-dram doses in gastric ulcer. Tincture, to third attenuation, as a general rule. Locally, in ulcers, it will destroy the pyogenic membrane.
